citations.narrative:
The contingency plan available for review at the time of inspection was dated in 2022, more than a year ago. The plan
must be reviewed at least annually to ensure that it continues to adequately address the requirements of this subsection
and the facility must maintain documentation of those annual reviews. Correct by ensuring the facility's contingency plan
is reviewed annually and maintaining documentation of the annual reviews.

A male Dachshund "Stanley" MC# 0A02603320 was examined by the attending veterinarian on 30-January-2024 and no
plan of treatment or care was noted on the medical record for his abnormal dental condition. Without proper
documentation, it is difficult to determine the efficacy of a treatment plan prescribed by the attending veterinarian. A
proper medical record includes the date the problem was found, a description of the problem, the name and frequency of
medications used, examination findings, test results, plans for treatment and care, and treatment procedures performed
must be recorded and a copy kept for review during inspection by APHIS officials. Correct by ensuring all records of any
treatments for problems identified in the dogs are recorded and maintained.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 19-July-2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.134(b) 
   
Contingency planning. 
The contingency plan available for review at the time of inspection was dated in 2022, more than a year ago. The plan 
must be reviewed at least annually to ensure that it continues to adequately address the requirements of this subsection 
and the facility must maintain documentation of those annual reviews. Correct by ensuring the facility's contingency plan 
is reviewed annually and maintaining documentation of the annual reviews. 
3.13(b)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
A male Dachshund "Stanley" MC# 0A02603320 was examined by the attending veterinarian on 30-January-2024 and no 
plan of treatment or care was noted on the medical record for his abnormal dental condition. Without proper 
documentation, it is difficult to determine the efficacy of a treatment plan prescribed by the attending veterinarian. A 
proper medical record includes the date the problem was found, a description of the problem, the name and frequency of 
medications used, examination findings, test results, plans for treatment and care, and treatment procedures performed 
must be recorded and a copy kept for review during inspection by APHIS officials. Correct by ensuring all records of any 
treatments for problems identified in the dogs are recorded and maintained. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 19-July-2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
